author: norwayfish
content: hypothetically, if I'm connected to a malicious CL that pushes an incorrect head to me, there's nothing in the EL that can detect that right? if blocks from transition block to malicious head are available over devp2p, I will pull them and sit on a chain that forks somewhere around the POS transition block?

author: ajsutton
content: If _valid_ blocks are available vis devp2p then you'd switch to that chain yes.  The CL has control of the fork choice rule and is trusted to decide the head, though there are some checks that are done such as refusing to revert finalized blocks.  But if your CL is malicious right from the start it can get you to sync any valid chain even if it's not the canonical one.

author: ajsutton
content: I mean probably yes, but having a malicious CL is as likely as having a malicious EL in which case it doesn't have to check PoW at all or even import blocks - it can just return whatever rubbish it wants from its RPC.  Basically, think of the EL and CL combination as a single piece of softare that's made up of two swappable components.  If either is malicious then the whole thing is malicious (albeit you do get some protections but not enough to make it in any way safe).
